intro: Pithecellobium palmeri var. recurvum, commonly known as the Palmer's pithecellobium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features compound leaves with elongated, leathery leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a pod containing several seeds, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in desert ecosystems.
